verses.plain: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

tokens.t: The word that came to Jeremiah from the
, saying,

verses.plain: Thus speaketh the LORD God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

tokens.t: Thus speaketh the
God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

verses.plain: For, lo, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the LORD: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.

tokens.t: For, lo, the days come, saith the
, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the
: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.

verses.plain: ¶ And these are the words that the LORD spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

tokens.t: ¶ And these
the words that the
spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

verses.plain: For thus saith the LORD; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.

tokens.t: For thus saith the
; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.

verses.plain: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

tokens.t: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

verses.plain: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

tokens.t: Alas! for that day
great, so that none
like it: it
even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

verses.plain: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:

tokens.t: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the
of hosts,
I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:

verses.plain: But they shall serve the LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

tokens.t: But they shall serve the
their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

verses.plain: ¶ Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the LORD; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

tokens.t: ¶ Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the
; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make
afraid.

verses.plain: For I am with thee, saith the LORD, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.

tokens.t: For I
with thee, saith the

, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.

verses.plain: For thus saith the LORD, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.

tokens.t: For thus saith the
, Thy bruise
incurable,
thy wound
grievous.

verses.plain: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

tokens.t: none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

verses.plain: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.

tokens.t: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity;
thy sins were increased.

verses.plain: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

tokens.t: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow
incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity:
thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

verses.plain: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

tokens.t: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

verses.plain: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the LORD; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

tokens.t: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the
; because they called thee an Outcast,
, This
Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

verses.plain: ¶ Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.

tokens.t: ¶ Thus saith the

; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.

verses.plain: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

tokens.t: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

verses.plain: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

tokens.t: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

verses.plain: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who
this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the

verses.plain: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

tokens.t: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

verses.plain: Behold, the whirlwind of the LORD goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.

tokens.t: Behold, the whirlwind of the
goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.

verses.plain: The fierce anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.

tokens.t: The fierce anger of the
shall not return, until he have done
, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.

footnotes.text: of fear…: or, there is fear, and not peace
that…: Heb. for binding up, or, pressing
